question: As shown in <image 1>, the Occupy Wall Street movement of 2011 grew to be an international movement. Supporters believe that the economic disparity between the highest economic class and the mid to lower economic classes is growing at an exponentially alarming rate. A sociologist who studies that movement by examining the interactions between members at Occupy camps would most likely use what theoretical approach?
description: The image depicts a crowded scene with a group of people gathered around a central figure who appears to be speaking or performing. The central figure is holding a guitar and wearing a red cap. The crowd includes individuals with cameras and recording devices, suggesting that this is a public event or protest. There are several flags visible, including one with the text "OCCUPY" and another with a red background. The setting appears to be an urban area with tall buildings and traffic lights in the background. The overall atmosphere suggests a protest or demonstration related to social or economic issues.
